definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: The string is said to be vibrating in its first overtone mode.
sentences.chinese: 据说这根弦是在它的第一泛音调式振动。

sentences.english: The problem is that acoustic sounds are in fact composed of many sound components called partials.
sentences.chinese: 问题是物理声音事实上是由许多叫做泛音的部分构成。

sentences.english: The string is said to be vibrating in its first overtone mode.
sentences.chinese: 这根弦可说成是在它的第一泛音调式振动。

sentences.english: This is called the Natural Harmonic Overtone Series.
sentences.chinese: 这就是所谓的自然泛音系列。

sentences.english: Music Timbre, as determined by overtones.
sentences.chinese: 音色，如由泛音所决定的。

sentences.english: The seventh fret harmonics pitch should match the fundamental frequency of the open string notes.
sentences.chinese: 第七品泛音音高应与基本的空弦音一致。

sentences.english: So he's up to something here with this rate of harmonic change.
sentences.chinese: 他在这里准备做一点什么，泛音的速度发生了变化。

sentences.english: The rate of harmonic change has slowed down considerably here.
sentences.chinese: 泛音的变化速度减得相当慢。

sentences.english: The second origin of music comes from the harmonic series, which is demonstrated by the open pipes without holes.
sentences.chinese: 音乐的第二种起源是泛音列，它由无音孔开管形成。

sentences.english: Rich, sweet chocolate flavor with light caramel overtones.
sentences.chinese: 富有又甜的巧克力以轻的焦糖泛音加味于。

definition: part (in multi-part instrumental or choral music), such as the soprano part or bass part
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
